Field Detail

vl

protected UVertexList vl
Master vertex list, contains all vertices for the face geometry contained in the UGeo instance. Use enable(NODUPL) to ensure no duplicate vertices exist.

Master vertex list, contains all vertices for the face geometry contained in the UGeo instance. Use enable(NODUPL) to ensure no duplicate vertices exist.

regenerateFaceData

public UGeo regenerateFaceData()
Regenerate face data (normals, centroid, vertices) for all faces.

Returns:

check

public UGeo check()

Checks the validity of connected UGeoGroup and UEdgeList instances, removing any edges or faces that are no longer found in this UGeo.

UGeo uses an internal flag (tainted) to track operations that might cause its internal state to need updating. If this flag is set, some methods (such as writeSTL(String) and all draw() / drawXXX()) will call check() automatically.

If check() is called by the user when tainted==false, no operations will take place. To force an update, use taint() or regenerateFaceData().

Returns:

set

public UGeo set(UGeo model)
Copies the mesh data contained model to this UGeo instance, replacing any existing data. The model.vl vertex list is copied using UVertexList.copy(), then face data is copied by creating new UFace instances using the UFace.vID vertex indices.

Parameters:
model -
Returns:

getGroupF

public java.util.ArrayList<UFace> getGroupF(int id)
Returns a list of UFace instances belonging to a given group of faces. When groups of triangles are added to UGeo by methods like triangleFan(), quadstrip() or add(UGeo), the start and end IDs for the faces produced by that operation is stored internally so that the group can later be retrieved.

Parameters:
id -
Returns:

Parameters:

getFacesInBB

public java.util.ArrayList<UFace> getFacesInBB(UBB bb,
                                               boolean allVertices)

Returns list of faces whose vertices are contained inside the provided UBB bounding box.

If allVertices==false, a face will be included if any of its vertices lie within the bounding box, otherwise all vertices must be contained in order to be included.

Parameters:
bb -
Returns:

beginShape

public UGeo beginShape(int _type)
Starts building a new series of faces, using the same logic as PApplet.beginShape(). Currently supports the following types: TRIANGLE_FAN, TRIANGLE_STRIP, TRIANGLES, QUADS, QUAD_STRIP While shape is being built vertices are stored in a temporary array, and only the ones that are used are copied to the vert vertexlist.

Parameters:
_type - Shape type (TRIANGLE_FAN, TRIANGLE_STRIP, TRIANGLES, QUADS, QUAD_STRIP)

triangulation

public UGeo triangulation(UVertexList vl)

Uses the Poly2Tri library to create a triangulation of the provided vertex list. Primarily useful for meshing irregular polygons and point sets representing 2.5D topologies, i.e. terrain-like geometry.

The triangulation logic acts in a 2D plane, hence point clouds representing true 3D volumes will give poor results, requiring convex hull or other re-meshing strategies.

See UPoly2Tri for details. By using UPoly2Tri directly it is also possible to triangulate polygons with holes.

Parameters:
vl -
Returns:

triangulation

public UGeo triangulation(UVertexList vl,
                          boolean reverse)

extrude

public UGeo extrude(float offs,
                    boolean makeSolid)
Returns a new UGeo where the faces in this mesh are extruded along vertex normals. If makeSolid==true the original faces are added and quads are added to fill in the side edges of the mesh boundary.

Parameters:
offs -
makeSolid -
Returns:
